weather_report:
The atmosphere over Downtown San Francisco embraces a somber palette of grays this afternoon, with the promise of rain palpable in the heavy clouds that blanket the sky. The world below appears muted, an echo of voices and footsteps softened by the gentle patter of raindrops that soon will dance on the pavement. As the temperature settles in the cool embrace of 57 degrees, the breeze whispers through the streets, carrying with it the scents of the earth waking from its slumber, inviting the cautious wanderer to step outside, though perhaps with an umbrella in hand. 

Tonight brings with it an intimate gathering of clouds, with rainfall continuing into the evening, teetering between a light refreshment and a gentle deluge. A cozy evening indoors might be just the remedy, where the warmth of tea and the soft glow of a lamp could cradle you against the damp chill. For those who must venture out, layering with a warm sweater beneath a raincoat would keep you snug, while the gusty winds tease at fabric flapping against your side. Whether indulging in warm soups at a nearby café or curling up with a book, this afternoon's weather invites us to savor the simple pleasures of comfort amidst a rain-kissed embrace.
